COMMENTS: Flights suspended with affected countries.

MEASURE: Health screenings in airports and border crossings

COMMENTS: Sanitation and hygiene recommendations
ban of public gatherings
travelers from coronavirus affected countries are required to self-quarantine, including appointed ministers and deputy ministers
South Sudan announces suspension of all classes in all schools and universities for the next month.
South sudan suspends training of its military.
South sudan has curfew from 8pm to 6am.
Governmnet directs postponement of weddings, festivals and other religious and sporting events.
Suspension of all internal flights
Suspension of passenger public transport, both public and private, between states.
Government directs that funeral gatherings be less than 5 people.
A circular has been distributed to all states instructing prison authorities to release 1,400 inmates to ease overcrowding.

Judiciary of South Suda, Ministry of Interior, justice and constitutional affairs and of the defence and veterans affairs, ordered to report to taskforce on conditions of inmates and to make recommnedations on decongestion of prisons and detention centres.
South Sudan government imposes curfew from 7pm to 6am until further notice.

MEASURE: Closure of businesses and public services
COMMENTS: All tea and shisha stalls are to be closed with immediate effect.
There is a ban on all passenger bodabodas, bodabodas shall be limited to transport of cargo. Bodabodas carrying passengers will be impounded by the police.
Only one passenger is allowed on a raksha at one time
Noaha taxis, mutatus and buses shall operate at half of their capacity only.

MEASURE: Closure of businesses and public services
COMMENTS: Closure of all bars.
Restaurants may only provide take away. Violators will be prosecuted.
Agro dealers and hardware stores are granted permission to open for business between 8am and 1pm to supply seeds, tools and parts for cultivation.
Permission is granted for farmers with land within 15km radius of the suburbs of Juba city to attend to farms during day without restrictions so long as they return home before curfew.
The curfew time will be altered to allow more freedom: It will now be from 10pm - 6am (was from 8pm-6am)

MEASURE: Closure of businesses and public services
COMMENTS: Restuarants and bars will open during non-curfew hours but must abide by strict social distancing rules

MEASURE: Closure of businesses and public services
COMMENTS: Shops and stores will re-open but under strict social distancing rules and with a maximum of 5 people in store at one time.
Boda boda and rickshaw drivers may resume business with max one passenger on a boda boda and two passengers on a rickshaw. However both rider and driver must wear masks.
South Sudan has closed all of it's borders to contain the spread of covid-19.
Both public and private businesses shall observe a strict 8 hour work day from 9:00-17:00 with  two weeks in two weeks out of 50% of the workforce to ensure social distancing.

MEASURE: Amendments to funeral and burial regulations
COMMENTS: Family members of deceased covid-19 infected persons are advised to conduct burial according to strict protocol guided by health care professionals. They are also informed not to bring remains to ancestral homes for burial in order to protect family members from the disease.
